## How to use **meta.arrR**

```{r setup}
library(meta.arrR)
library(dplyr)
```

### 1. Load parameters

```{r load_parameters}

# get starting values
starting_values <- meta.arrR::default_starting

# get parameters
parameters <- meta.arrR::default_parameters

# set time per iterations
min_per_i <- 120

# run the model for n years
years <- 1
max_i <- (60 * 24 * 365 * years) / min_per_i

# save results only every m days
days <- 5 # which((max_i %% ((24 / (min_per_i / 60)) * 1:365)) == 0)
save_each <- (24 / (min_per_i / 60)) * days

days <- 1
seagrass_each <- (24 / (min_per_i / 60)) * days

n <- 9

days <- 1
parameters$move_residence_mean <- (24 / (min_per_i / 60)) * days
parameters$move_residence_sd <- 0.0
parameters$move_lambda <- 0.0
```

### 2. Setup simulation enviroment

```{r setup_envirnment}
# create 5 reef cells in center of seafloor
reef_matrix <- matrix(data = c(-1, 0, 0, 1, 1, 0, 0, -1, 0, 0), 
                      ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE)

# setup extent
dimensions <- c(50, 50)

parameters$nutrients_loss <- 0.01

stable_vals <- arrR::get_req_nutrients(bg_biomass = starting_values$bg_biomass,
                                       ag_biomass = starting_values$ag_biomass,
                                       parameters = parameters)

starting_values$nutrients_pool <- stable_vals$nutrients_pool

starting_values$detritus_pool <- stable_vals$detritus_pool

input_values <- stable_vals$nutrients_pool * parameters$nutrients_loss

nutrients_input <- simulate_nutr_input(n = n, max_i = max_i, input_mn = input_values, 
                                       frequency = 5)

metasyst <- setup_meta(n = n, reef = reef_matrix, seafloor_xy = NULL, 
                       dimensions = dimensions, max_i = max_i,
                       starting_values = starting_values, parameters = parameters)

# plot(metasyst)
# plot(nutrients_input)
```

```{r run_model}
result <- run_simulation_meta(metasyst = metasyst, nutrients_input = nutrients_input,
                              parameters = parameters, movement = "behav",
                              max_i = max_i, save_each = save_each, min_per_i = min_per_i)
```

### 3. Analyze results

```{r analyze_results}
plot(result, what = "seafloor")

plot_local_abund(result)

get_abundance(result) %>% 
  dplyr::group_by(meta) %>% 
  dplyr::summarise(abundance = mean(abundance))

# get_abundance(result) %>%
#   tidyr::pivot_wider(values_from = abundance, names_from = meta, names_prefix = "meta")
```
